ygData.subject: Re: Missed Notes
ygData.msgSnippet: For the sake of a data set, I ve got a 36th bard on Tarew Marr. Something else of note, of the 15/100 that I did get for Celerity, about 8 of those were in a
ygData.messageBody:
For the sake of a data set, I've got a 36th bard on Tarew Marr.

Something else of note, of the 15/100 that I did get for Celerity, about 8
of those were in a row. As I mentioned before, the random number generator
seems to have a habit of generating failures fairly well clumped together so
the feeling of more failures might come from this, but if you watch over a
larger set, the %'s still come out correctly (i.e. 5 in a row out of 100 is
still 5%, even though it seems 'bad' when you're in that clump).

-----Original Message-----
From: Lost Child <lostchild@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, August 11, 1999 10:28 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Missed Notes


>From: "Lost Child" <lostchild@...>
>
>Could the missed notes only happens on certain server(s)? I am a lv 44
bard
>on Cazic-Thule server, and I haven't notice any extra missed notes since
>this thing started. Not enough to notice it anyway. Or maybe it only
>affects wood elf or human bard? I am a half elf. Or maybe it is level
>related? Seems like a lot of the people who have the missed notes are in
>their high 20s to high 30s.
>
>>
>>Let's consider the possibility that it (the missed note bug) may not
happen
>>_for_everyone_ - _all_of_the_time_.
>>
>>It's very possible that there is a bug but it does not affect everyone the
>>same way.
>>
>
